etymologies: late Middle English: from French résistance, from late Latin resistentia, from the verb resistere ‘hold back’ (see resist)

definitions: the refusal to accept or comply with something; the attempt to prevent something by action or argument

examples.text: she put up no resistance to being led away

shortDefinitions: refusal to accept or comply with something

examples.text: government forces were unable to crush guerrilla-style resistance

shortDefinitions: use of force or violence to oppose person or thing

definitions: a secret organization resisting authority, especially in an occupied country

examples.text: he went underground and joined the resistance

definitions: the underground movement formed in France during World War II to fight the German occupying forces and the Vichy government.
shortDefinitions: underground movement formed in France during Second World War to fight German occupying forces

definitions: the ability not to be affected by something, especially adversely

examples.text: some of us have a lower resistance to cold than others

shortDefinitions: ability not to be affected by something

definitions: lack of sensitivity to a drug, insecticide, etc., especially as a result of continued exposure or genetic change

examples.text: many insects show resistance to at least one chemical

shortDefinitions: lack of sensitivity to drug, insecticide, etc.

definitions: the impeding, slowing, or stopping effect exerted by one material thing on another

examples.text: air resistance would need to be reduced by streamlining

shortDefinitions: impeding or stopping effect exerted by one material thing on another

definitions: the degree to which a substance or device opposes the passage of an electric current, causing energy dissipation. Ohm's law resistance (measured in ohms) is equal to the voltage divided by the current.
shortDefinitions: degree to which substance or device opposes passage of electric current

definitions: a resistor or other circuit component which opposes the passage of an electric current.
shortDefinitions: resistor or other circuit component which opposes passage of electric current
